segment.source: MD Conversion - Configure access to corporate email using email profiles with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Configure access to corporate email using email profiles with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Configure access to corporate email using email profiles with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Configure access to corporate email using email profiles with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Email profiles in help you create, deploy and monitor Exchange ActiveSync email settings on devices.
segment.target: Email profiles in help you create, deploy and monitor Exchange ActiveSync email settings on devices.

segment.source: This lets user’s access corporate email on their personal devices without any required setup on their part.
segment.target: This lets user’s access corporate email on their personal devices without any required setup on their part.

segment.source: You can use email profiles to configure the following device types:
segment.target: You can use email profiles to configure the following device types:

segment.source: Devices that run Windows Phone 8 and later
segment.target: Devices that run Windows Phone 8 and later

segment.source: Devices that run iOS 7.1 and later
segment.target: Devices that run iOS 7.1 and later

segment.source: Devices that run Samsung KNOX Standard (4.0 and later)
segment.target: Devices that run Samsung KNOX Standard (4.0 and later)

segment.source: Devices that run Windows 10 desktop, Windows 10 Mobile, and later
segment.target: Devices that run Windows 10 desktop, Windows 10 Mobile, and later

segment.source: In addition to configuring an email account on the device, you can also configure synchronization settings such as how much email to synchronize, and depending on the device type, the content types to synchronize.
segment.target: In addition to configuring an email account on the device, you can also configure synchronization settings such as how much email to synchronize, and depending on the device type, the content types to synchronize.

segment.source: Whenever possible, choose the most secure options that your email infrastructure and client operating systems can support.
segment.target: Whenever possible, choose the most secure options that your email infrastructure and client operating systems can support.

segment.source: Email profiles provide a convenient method to centrally distribute and manage email settings that your devices already support.
segment.target: Email profiles provide a convenient method to centrally distribute and manage email settings that your devices already support.

segment.source: does not add email functionality.
segment.target: does not add email functionality.

segment.source: How email profiles are secured
segment.target: How email profiles are secured

segment.source: Email profiles can be secured using one of two methods:
segment.target: Email profiles can be secured using one of two methods:

segment.source: Certificates
segment.target: Certificates

segment.source: When you create the email profile, you choose a SCEP certificate profile that you have previously created in .
segment.target: When you create the email profile, you choose a SCEP certificate profile that you have previously created in .

segment.source: This is known as the identity certificate and is used to authenticate against a trusted certificate profile (or a root certificate) you created to establish that the user’s device is allowed to connect.
segment.target: This is known as the identity certificate and is used to authenticate against a trusted certificate profile (or a root certificate) you created to establish that the user’s device is allowed to connect.

segment.source: The trusted certificate is deployed to the computer that authenticates the email connection, typically, the Exchange server.
segment.target: The trusted certificate is deployed to the computer that authenticates the email connection, typically, the Exchange server.

segment.source: For more information about how to create and use certificate profiles in , see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about how to create and use certificate profiles in , see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Username and password
segment.target: Username and password

segment.source: The user authenticates to the Exchange server by providing their username and password.
segment.target: The user authenticates to the Exchange server by providing their username and password.

segment.source: The password is not contained in the email profile, so the user will need to supply this when they connect to email.
segment.target: The password is not contained in the email profile, so the user will need to supply this when they connect to email.

segment.source: Create an email profile
segment.target: Create an email profile

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.

segment.source: Configure one of the following policy types:
segment.target: Configure one of the following policy types:

segment.source: Email Profile for Samsung KNOX Standard (4.0 and later)
segment.target: Email Profile for Samsung KNOX Standard (4.0 and later)

segment.source: Email Profile (iOS 7.1 and later)
segment.target: Email Profile (iOS 7.1 and later)

segment.source: Email Profile (Windows Phone 8 and later)
segment.target: Email Profile (Windows Phone 8 and later)

segment.source: Email Profile (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later)
segment.target: Email Profile (Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile and later)

segment.source: You can only create and deploy a custom email profile policy.
segment.target: You can only create and deploy a custom email profile policy.

segment.source: Recommended settings are not available.
segment.target: Recommended settings are not available.

segment.source: For more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune topic.
segment.target: For more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune topic.

segment.source: Use the following table to help you configure Samsung KNOX email profile settings:
segment.target: Use the following table to help you configure Samsung KNOX email profile settings:

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: Enter a unique name for the email profile.
segment.target: Enter a unique name for the email profile.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the email profile and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
segment.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the email profile and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

segment.source: Host
segment.target: Host

segment.source: Specify the hostname of your company Exchange Server that hosts Exchange ActiveSync services.
segment.target: Specify the hostname of your company Exchange Server that hosts Exchange ActiveSync services.

segment.source: Account name
segment.target: Account name

segment.source: Specify the display name for the email account as it will appear to users on their devices.
segment.target: Specify the display name for the email account as it will appear to users on their devices.

segment.source: Username
segment.target: Username

segment.source: Select how the username for the email account will be obtained.
segment.target: Select how the username for the email account will be obtained.

segment.source: Select Username for an On-premises Exchange server or select User Principal Name for Office 365.
segment.target: Select Username for an On-premises Exchange server or select User Principal Name for Office 365.

segment.source: Email address
segment.target: Email address

segment.source: Select how the email address for the user on each device is generated.
segment.target: Select how the email address for the user on each device is generated.

segment.source: Select Primary SMTP Address to use the primary SMTP address to log into Exchange or use User Principal Name to use the full principal name as the email address.
segment.target: Select Primary SMTP Address to use the primary SMTP address to log into Exchange or use User Principal Name to use the full principal name as the email address.

segment.source: Authentication method
segment.target: Authentication method

segment.source: Select either Username and Password or Certificates as the authentication method used by the email profile.
segment.target: Select either Username and Password or Certificates as the authentication method used by the email profile.

segment.source: Select a client certificate for client authentication (Identity Certificate)
segment.target: Select a client certificate for client authentication (Identity Certificate)

segment.source: Select the client SCEP certificate that you previously created that will be used to authenticate the Exchange connection.
segment.target: Select the client SCEP certificate that you previously created that will be used to authenticate the Exchange connection.

segment.source: For more information about how to use certificate profiles in , see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about how to use certificate profiles in , see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: This option is displayed only when the authentication method is Certificates.
segment.target: This option is displayed only when the authentication method is Certificates.

segment.source: Use S/MIME
segment.target: Use S/MIME

segment.source: Send outgoing email using S/MIME encryption.
segment.target: Send outgoing email using S/MIME encryption.

segment.source: Signing certificate
segment.target: Signing certificate

segment.source: Select the signing certificate that will be used to sign outgoing email.
segment.target: Select the signing certificate that will be used to sign outgoing email.

segment.source: This option is displayed only when you select Use S/MIME.
segment.target: This option is displayed only when you select Use S/MIME.

segment.source: Number of days of email to synchronize
segment.target: Number of days of email to synchronize

segment.source: From the drop-down list, select the number of days of email that you want to synchronize or select Unlimited to synchronize all available email.
segment.target: From the drop-down list, select the number of days of email that you want to synchronize or select Unlimited to synchronize all available email.

segment.source: Sync schedule
segment.target: Sync schedule

segment.source: Select the schedule by which devices will synchronize data from the Exchange Server.
segment.target: Select the schedule by which devices will synchronize data from the Exchange Server.

segment.source: You can also select As Messages arrive which synchronizes data as soon as it arrives, or Manual, where the user of the device must initiate the synchronization.
segment.target: You can also select As Messages arrive which synchronizes data as soon as it arrives, or Manual, where the user of the device must initiate the synchronization.

segment.source: Use SSL
segment.target: Use SSL

segment.source: Use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) communication when sending emails, receiving emails, and communicating with the Exchange Server.
segment.target: Use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) communication when sending emails, receiving emails, and communicating with the Exchange Server.

segment.source: For devices that run Samsung KNOX 4.0 or later, you must export your Exchange Server’s SSL certificate and deploy it as an Android Trusted Certificate Profile in .
segment.target: For devices that run Samsung KNOX 4.0 or later, you must export your Exchange Server’s SSL certificate and deploy it as an Android Trusted Certificate Profile in .

segment.source: does not support accessing this certificate if it is installed on the Exchange Server by other means.
segment.target: does not support accessing this certificate if it is installed on the Exchange Server by other means.

segment.source: Content type to synchronize
segment.target: Content type to synchronize

segment.source: Select the content types that you want to synchronize to devices.
segment.target: Select the content types that you want to synchronize to devices.

segment.source: Choose from Email, Contacts, Calendar, Tasks, or Notes.
segment.target: Choose from Email, Contacts, Calendar, Tasks, or Notes.

segment.source: Use the following table to help you configure iOS email profile settings:
segment.target: Use the following table to help you configure iOS email profile settings:

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: Enter a unique name for the email profile.
segment.target: Enter a unique name for the email profile.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the email profile and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
segment.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the email profile and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

segment.source: Host
segment.target: Host

segment.source: Specify the hostname of your company Exchange Server that hosts Exchange ActiveSync services.
segment.target: Specify the hostname of your company Exchange Server that hosts Exchange ActiveSync services.

segment.source: Account name
segment.target: Account name

segment.source: Specify the display name for the email account as it will appear to users on their devices.
segment.target: Specify the display name for the email account as it will appear to users on their devices.

segment.source: Username
segment.target: Username

segment.source: Select how the user name for the email account on each device is generated.
segment.target: Select how the user name for the email account on each device is generated.

segment.source: Select Primary SMTP Address to use the primary SMTP address to log into Exchange or use User Principal Name to use the full principal name as the email address.
segment.target: Select Primary SMTP Address to use the primary SMTP address to log into Exchange or use User Principal Name to use the full principal name as the email address.

segment.source: Email address
segment.target: Email address

segment.source: Select how the email address for the user on each device is generated.
segment.target: Select how the email address for the user on each device is generated.

segment.source: Select Primary SMTP Address to use the primary SMTP address to log into Exchange or use User Principal Name to use the full principal name as the email address.
segment.target: Select Primary SMTP Address to use the primary SMTP address to log into Exchange or use User Principal Name to use the full principal name as the email address.

segment.source: Authentication method
segment.target: Authentication method

segment.source: Select either Username and Password or Certificates as the authentication method used by the email profile.
segment.target: Select either Username and Password or Certificates as the authentication method used by the email profile.

segment.source: Select a client certificate for client authentication (Identity Certificate)
segment.target: Select a client certificate for client authentication (Identity Certificate)

segment.source: Select the client SCEP certificate that you previously created that will be used to authenticate the Exchange connection.
segment.target: Select the client SCEP certificate that you previously created that will be used to authenticate the Exchange connection.

segment.source: For more information about how to use certificate profiles in , see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about how to use certificate profiles in , see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: This option is displayed only when the authentication method is Certificates.
segment.target: This option is displayed only when the authentication method is Certificates.

segment.source: Use S/MIME
segment.target: Use S/MIME

segment.source: Send outgoing email using S/MIME encryption.
segment.target: Send outgoing email using S/MIME encryption.

segment.source: Signing certificate
segment.target: Signing certificate

segment.source: Optionally, select the signing certificate that will be used to sign outgoing email.
segment.target: Optionally, select the signing certificate that will be used to sign outgoing email.

segment.source: This option is displayed only when you select Use S/MIME.
segment.target: This option is displayed only when you select Use S/MIME.

segment.source: Number of days of email to synchronize
segment.target: Number of days of email to synchronize

segment.source: From the drop-down list, select the number of days of email that you want to synchronize or select Unlimited to synchronize all available email.
segment.target: From the drop-down list, select the number of days of email that you want to synchronize or select Unlimited to synchronize all available email.

segment.source: Use SSL
segment.target: Use SSL

segment.source: Use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) communication when sending emails, receiving emails, and communicating with the Exchange Server.
segment.target: Use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) communication when sending emails, receiving emails, and communicating with the Exchange Server.

segment.source: Allow messages to be moved to other email accounts
segment.target: Allow messages to be moved to other email accounts

segment.source: Allow users to move email messages between different accounts they have configured on their device.
segment.target: Allow users to move email messages between different accounts they have configured on their device.

segment.source: Allow email to be sent from third-party applications
segment.target: Allow email to be sent from third-party applications

segment.source: Allow users to send email from apps other than the default email app.
segment.target: Allow users to send email from apps other than the default email app.

segment.source: Synchronize recently used email addresses
segment.target: Synchronize recently used email addresses

segment.source: Synchronize the list of email addresses that have been recently used on the device.
segment.target: Synchronize the list of email addresses that have been recently used on the device.

segment.source: Use the following table to help you configure Windows Phone email profile settings:
segment.target: Use the following table to help you configure Windows Phone email profile settings:

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: Enter a unique name for the email profile.
segment.target: Enter a unique name for the email profile.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the email profile and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
segment.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the email profile and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

segment.source: Host
segment.target: Host

segment.source: Specify the hostname of your company Exchange Server that hosts Exchange ActiveSync services.
segment.target: Specify the hostname of your company Exchange Server that hosts Exchange ActiveSync services.

segment.source: Account name
segment.target: Account name

segment.source: Specify the display name for the email account as it will appear to users on their devices.
segment.target: Specify the display name for the email account as it will appear to users on their devices.

segment.source: Username
segment.target: Username

segment.source: Select how the user name for the email account on each device is generated.
segment.target: Select how the user name for the email account on each device is generated.

segment.source: Select Primary SMTP Address to use the primary SMTP address to log into Exchange or use User Principal Name to use the full principal name as the email address.
segment.target: Select Primary SMTP Address to use the primary SMTP address to log into Exchange or use User Principal Name to use the full principal name as the email address.

segment.source: Email Address
segment.target: Email Address

segment.source: Select how the email address for the user on each client device is generated.
segment.target: Select how the email address for the user on each client device is generated.

segment.source: Select Primary SMTP Address to use the primary SMTP address to log into Exchange or use User Principal Name to use the full principal name as the email address.
segment.target: Select Primary SMTP Address to use the primary SMTP address to log into Exchange or use User Principal Name to use the full principal name as the email address.

segment.source: Number of days of email to synchronize
segment.target: Number of days of email to synchronize

segment.source: From the drop-down list, select the number of days of email that you want to synchronize or select Unlimited to synchronize all available email.
segment.target: From the drop-down list, select the number of days of email that you want to synchronize or select Unlimited to synchronize all available email.

segment.source: Sync Schedule
segment.target: Sync Schedule

segment.source: Select the schedule by which devices will synchronize data from the Exchange Server.
segment.target: Select the schedule by which devices will synchronize data from the Exchange Server.

segment.source: You can also select As Messages arrive which synchronizes data as soon as it arrives, or Manual, where the user of the device must initiate the synchronization.
segment.target: You can also select As Messages arrive which synchronizes data as soon as it arrives, or Manual, where the user of the device must initiate the synchronization.

segment.source: Use SSL
segment.target: Use SSL

segment.source: Use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) communication when sending emails, receiving emails, and communicating with the Exchange Server.
segment.target: Use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) communication when sending emails, receiving emails, and communicating with the Exchange Server.

segment.source: Content type to synchronize
segment.target: Content type to synchronize

segment.source: Select the content types that you want to synchronize to devices.
segment.target: Select the content types that you want to synchronize to devices.

segment.source: Choose from Email, Contacts, Calendar, or Tasks.
segment.target: Choose from Email, Contacts, Calendar, or Tasks.

segment.source: If you have deployed an email profile and then wish to change the values for Exchange ActiveSync host or Email address, you must delete the existing email profile and create a new one with the required values.
segment.target: If you have deployed an email profile and then wish to change the values for Exchange ActiveSync host or Email address, you must delete the existing email profile and create a new one with the required values.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Save Policy.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Save Policy.

segment.source: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.
segment.target: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.

segment.source: Deploy an email profile
segment.target: Deploy an email profile

segment.source: Deploy the email profile to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.
segment.target: Deploy the email profile to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.

segment.source: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: A status summary and alerts on the Overview page of the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.
segment.target: A status summary and alerts on the Overview page of the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

segment.source: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.
segment.target: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.

segment.source: If you want to remove an email profile from a device, edit the deployment and remove any groups of which the device is a member.
segment.target: If you want to remove an email profile from a device, edit the deployment and remove any groups of which the device is a member.

segment.source: Next Steps
segment.target: Next Steps

segment.source: After successful deployment, user’s devices will be provisioned with the correct settings to access corporate email.
segment.target: After successful deployment, user’s devices will be provisioned with the correct settings to access corporate email.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.source: Enable access to company resources with Microsoft Intune - deleted
segment.target: Enable access to company resources with Microsoft Intune - deleted
